primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement of the Eternal/Infinite into the temporal/finite to rescue humanity from the 'Abyss' of death and darkness.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Eternal has done a temporal act
The Infinite has become a finite fact
For us and for our salvation he came down from heaven
believing you may have life in his name
the truth about the salvation of the human race

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Divine Will
tekstueel_bewijs: Wisdom from on high that proceeds from the mouth of God
For us and for our salvation
He promises his own self to us

helper.identificatie: The Incarnation / Nicene Dogma / The Evangelist John
tekstueel_bewijs: these are written [so] that you may believe
Thomas... becomes the one who tells us finally and completely who Jesus is

tegenstander.identificatie: Death, The Abyss, Darkness, Impotence of human wishes
tekstueel_bewijs: The Pilgrim Way has led to the Abyss
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a lack of effort but the ontological reality of death and the 'Abyss' which human potential cannot bridge.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transition from doubt to belief in the hearer.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer (Doubting Thomas)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (believing) is a response to the primary program (God's act). The hearer is 'blessed' into belief rather than achieving it by will.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God → Salvation/Life → We who must die

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Eternal has done a temporal act
The light shines in the darkness
He promises his own self to us
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We who must die demand a miracle

voorbeelden: yearned to feel at home here
determine, once and for all, 'What child is this?'
these are written [so] that you may believe
Nothing can save us that is possible
the impossibility of the human condition is met by the possibility of God

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Impossible' becoming 'Possible' through God. It emphasizes human impotence (lack of Pouvoir) met by Divine Power.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Bleak Midwinter/Death) through ~S1 (Religious searching leads to Abyss) to S1 (The Miracle/Incarnation).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Infinite becoming a finite fact'—a vertical intervention.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death is described as a 'white eye' and an 'Abyss'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the subject of the rescue; humans are the 'dying' who receive a miracle they cannot produce.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Eternal has done a temporal act.
The Pilgrim Way has led to the Abyss.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Thomas is not used as a moral example of how to stop doubting, but as a narrative witness to who Jesus is.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Thomas is the 'Receiver' of the revelation, not the 'Subject' of a moral victory.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'making it happen' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; faith is a gift/blessing bestowed by the appearing Christ.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon perfectly integrates the liturgical season, the biblical text, and the dogmatic core.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The Infinite become a finite fact... for us and for our salvation.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The blessing of Christ creates the competence to believe.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: A masterclass in grace-oriented narrative. The Subject is consistently God; the Object is life; the Receiver is the helpless human.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for Advent/Incarnation.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's act) precedes and enables the response (Belief).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon avoids all moralistic traps by grounding the 'ought' of belief in the 'is' of the Incarnation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the Auden quotes; semiotics shows these quotes function to establish the 'Opponent' (Abyss) and the 'Subject' (Miracle).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains John 20; semiotics explains how the hearer is positioned as the 'blessed' receiver of that text's promise.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Nicene Dogma' is not a static object but a 'Helper' actant that enables the Subject (God) to be known by the Receiver.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Last month of the year' motif to signify the end of human agency (Savoir/Pouvoir-faire), necessitating a new Subject.
